item.title: Seven Questions to Make Sense of Craig Wright's Signature Proofs
item.description:
Seven Questions to Make Sense of Craig Wright's Signature Proofs

The Australian computer scientist Craig Steven Wright is sending shock waves throughout the Bitcoin world, as he once again claims to be the man who invented Bitcoin. At the heart of the story, Wright himself published a blog post suggesting he signed a message with one of Satoshi Nakamoto's private keys.

item.title: Looking to buy coins from early blocks. Will pay 5x current market. * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
Looking to buy coins from early blocks. Will pay 5x current market. * /r/Bitcoin

Hey guys. I'm looking to buy coins from the earliest block possible. Will someone sell me the keys? I'll pay top dollar. It's for an experiment I...

item.title: Coinsource adds 9 new Bitcoin ATMs in Los Angeles and Las Vegas
item.description:
Coinsource adds 9 new Bitcoin ATMs in Los Angeles and Las Vegas

National Bitcoin ATM (automated teller machine) network Coinsource (Clark, Sharp, and Reynolds, LLC, DBA CoinSource) just announced its largest installation yet by adding seven new machines in the Los Angeles area and two more in Las Vegas.

item.title: 21 Inc Unveils Plan to Make Every Computer a Bitcoin Computer - CoinDesk
item.description:
21 Inc Unveils Plan to Make Every Computer a Bitcoin Computer - CoinDesk

Balaji Srinivasan, co-founder and CEO of 21 Inc., announced the launch of the 21 software package at the Consensus 2016 blockchain conference, allowing anyone with a computer to receive bitcoin in a multitude of ways.

item.title: Permissioned Blockchain Chain Open Standard 1 Goes Public
item.description:
Permissioned Blockchain Chain Open Standard 1 Goes Public

Blockchain providers are the center of attention these days, and Chain Inc. has released their Chain Open Standard 1. This initiative is an open source blockchain protocol developed by the provider itself, as well as several startups and financial services companies in the world.

item.title: Wikileaks Criticizes BBC, LRB and Economist After Craig Wright Controversy
item.description:
Wikileaks Criticizes BBC, LRB and Economist After Craig Wright Controversy

The recent hoax surrounding the self-claiming fake creator of Bitcoin Craig Wright led by mainstream media outlets including BBC, Economist and LRB have agitated many experts in the industry and supporters of Bitcoin, including WikiLeaks.

item.title: Delaware to 'embrace the emerging blockchain and smart contract technology industry,' with distributed ledger shares
item.description:
Delaware to 'embrace the emerging blockchain and smart contract technology industry,' with distributed ledger shares

The state of Delaware is perhaps the most friendly jurisdictions for Bitcoin and blockchain technology in the U.S. Delaware Governor, Jack Markell, recently announced the details of a new initiative to "embrace the emerging blockchain and smart contract technology industry."

item.title: Dueling Blockchain Visions Face Off in Consensus 2016 Finale - CoinDesk
item.description:
Dueling Blockchain Visions Face Off in Consensus 2016 Finale - CoinDesk

The final panel on the last full day of Consensus 2016 featured a gentlemen's dual of philosophies over the merits of public and private blockchains by two of the biggest names in the business.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Technical Analysis for 05/04/2016 - Short-Term Symmetrical Triangle - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Technical Analysis for 05/04/2016 - Short-Term Symmetrical Triangle - NEWSBTC

Bitcoin price is moving inside a symmetrical triangle consolidation pattern and is hovering around the top of the formation. Bitcoin Price Key Highlights Bitcoin price is moving inside a symmetrical triangle consolidation pattern and is hovering around the top of the formation.

item.title: Ethereum Can Solve The Internet of Thing's Problems
item.description:
Ethereum Can Solve The Internet of Thing's Problems

Ethereum is a platform that offers many benefits for the Internet of Things, smart contracts and low confirmation times can solve some of the challenges ahead of IoT deployments: security and scalability. The Internet of Things (IoT) in its broader definition, is the interconnection of many heterogeneous devices -ranging from desktop computers, embedded systems, small sensors, among others-.
